title: Rename branding to QuickBazar and update logo/PWA icons

requirements.summary: Rename all visible “ShopHub” branding to “QuickBazar” across UI and app metadata (HTML + PWA manifest + Apple web app title), ensuring no remaining user-facing ShopHub/Marketplace naming.
acceptanceCriteria: Top navigation brand text shows “QuickBazar” instead of “ShopHub”.
frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest uses “QuickBazar” for name/short_name (and does not mention “ShopHub” or “Marketplace”).
A case-insensitive search in the frontend codebase shows no remaining user-facing “ShopHub” branding.

file_operations.description: Update the top navigation brand text from “ShopHub” to “QuickBazar” (consistent casing, no space), and align any related accessibility labels/alt text that are part of the brand presentation.
Set the document <title> to “QuickBazar” and update the apple-mobile-web-app-title meta tag to “QuickBazar” to match the new branding.

Update PWA manifest name/short_name to “QuickBazar” and ensure no occurrence of “ShopHub” or “Marketplace” remains in manifest user-visible fields (including description if needed). Keep existing icon src paths unchanged.
Update offline page metadata/title to reflect “QuickBazar” (e.g., document title), ensuring the offline experience does not display legacy “Marketplace” branding.
Replace user-facing “ShopHub” mentions with “QuickBazar” in About page headings/body copy.
Replace user-facing “shophub” branding in contact details (e.g., support email text/link) with “QuickBazar”-appropriate branding so users do not see “ShopHub”.
Update service worker cache naming/versioning to reflect “QuickBazar” branding (to avoid keeping old branded cache names) while preserving existing offline and precache behavior.

requirements.summary: Replace the existing header logo reference with a newly generated QuickBazar logo stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it crisply without layout shift.
acceptanceCriteria: TopNav no longer references /assets/Colorful Illustrative Online Shop Logo.jpg.jpeg.
TopNav renders the newly generated logo image from /assets/generated/ and the image alt text is updated to “QuickBazar logo”.
Logo renders crisply on mobile and desktop without layout shift (no stretched or pixelated appearance).

file_operations.description: Add the newly generated QuickBazar logo asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/quickbazar-logo.dim_512x512.png (transparent background), matching the provided image requirement.

Remove the legacy header logo reference (/assets/Colorful Illustrative Online Shop Logo.jpg.jpeg) and render the new generated logo from frontend/public/assets/generated/quickbazar-logo.dim_512x512.png. Update alt text to “QuickBazar logo”, and adjust sizing/rendering (e.g., explicit dimensions and appropriate object-fit) to ensure crisp display and prevent layout shift.

requirements.summary: Regenerate and replace existing PWA icon assets with QuickBazar-branded icons, keeping the same filenames/paths referenced by the manifest.
acceptanceCriteria: The following existing files are replaced with newly generated QuickBazar-branded icons while keeping the same filenames and dimensions: pwa-icon.dim_192x192.png, pwa-icon.dim_512x512.png, pwa-maskable.dim_512x512.png, apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png.
frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest continues to reference the same icon paths under /assets/generated/ and installs successfully as a PWA.
On iOS/Android “Add to Home Screen”, the installed icon shows the updated QuickBazar design (not the old icon).

file_operations.description: Replace the existing 192x192 PWA icon file contents with the newly generated QuickBazar-branded design, keeping the exact same filename and path.
Replace the existing 512x512 PWA icon file contents with the newly generated QuickBazar-branded design, keeping the exact same filename and path.
Replace the existing 512x512 maskable icon file contents with the newly generated QuickBazar-branded design (with safe padding), keeping the exact same filename and path.
Replace the existing 180x180 Apple touch icon file contents with the newly generated QuickBazar-branded design, keeping the exact same filename and path.
